definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: The manager had a fierce face, and the customers also lacked pleasant voices.
sentences.chinese: 掌柜是一副凶脸孔，主顾也没有好声气。

sentences.english: The difference between these three techniques is the different ways of the tone and mood correspondence.
sentences.chinese: 三种呼应的区别在于呼应中声气感应的方法不同。

sentences.english: The book is in compliance with Liang Shuming's Main Points of Chinese Culture.
sentences.chinese: 此书与梁漱溟《中国文化要义》声气相求，互为奥援。

sentences.english: The difference between these three techniques is the different ways of the tone and mood correspond…
sentences.chinese: 三种呼应的区别在于呼应中声气感应的方法不同。

sentences.english: He tends to snap at people when he gets impatient.
sentences.chinese: 他一不耐烦的时候就对人没有好声气。

definition: tone of voice/the way one speaks/manner of expression/tone
to choke with emotion/to choke on a piece of food
long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
